articles.title: DPRK Order Awarded to Councilor of Chinese Embassy
articles.content:
DPRK Order Awarded to Councilor of Chinese Embassy
 Pyongyang, January 17 (KCNA) -- DPRK Order of Friendship was awarded to Miao Weicheng, councilor of the Chinese embassy here, with due ceremony at the Mansudae Assembly Hall on Tuesday.
					 Present there were Yang Hyong Sop, vice-president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly, Kim Song Nam, vice department director of the C.C., the Workers' Party of Korea, officials concerned, Chinese Ambassador to the DPRK Liu Hongcai and his embassy officials.
					
					 After a decree of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly was read out, DPRK Order of Friendship 2nd Class was awarded to the councilor who made a contribution to boosting the traditional relations of friendship and cooperation between the DPRK and China, true to the noble intentions of the top leaders.

articles.title: AP Delegation Goes Back Home
articles.content:
AP Delegation Goes Back Home
 Pyongyang, January 17 (KCNA) -- The delegation of the Associated Press of the United States headed by President and Chief Executive Officer Thomas Curley left here for home on Tuesday.

articles.title: Law on Management of Seed Crops Adopted in DPRK
articles.content:
Law on Management of Seed Crops Adopted 
 Pyongyang, January 17 (KCNA) -- Law on management of seed crops was adopted in the DPRK by a decree of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly on December 14, Juche 100 (2011).
					 The law consists of five chapters -- introduction of the law, registration of seed crops, production of seed crops, safekeeping and use of seed crops and guidance and supervision over management of seed crops -- and 43 articles.
					
					 The adoption of the law will help improve the management of seed crops in the country.

articles.title: Unhasu Orchestra Gives New Year's Concert in Hamhung
articles.content:
Unhasu Orchestra Gives New Year's Concert in Hamhung
 Pyongyang, January 17 (KCNA) -- Creators and artistes of the Unhasu Orchestra started its local performance tour for the new year in South Hamgyong Province.
					 The first performance was given at the Hamhung Grand Theatre on Tuesday.
					
					 It was enjoyed by officials of the party, power organs and working people's organizations in the province and officials and working people of industrial enterprises including the February 8 Vinalon Complex, the Ryongsong Machine Complex and the Hungnam Fertilizer Complex.
					
					 After the playing of the national anthem, all the performers and audience paid silent tribute to General Secretary Kim Jong Il in humblest reverence.
					
					 Its repertoire included female trio and chorus "Cantata to Comrade Kim Jong Il", female trio and female pangchang immortal masterpiece "Song of Best Wishes", male solo and pangchang "When We Sing of Songun", male sextet and pangchang "Appearing in the East and in the West, It's the Anti-Japanese Guerilla Style", orchestral music and chorus "On the Path of Struggle under the Leadership of the General" and narration and orchestral music "Korea Has Risen Up".
					
					 Melodies of the hymns on the leader solemnly rang out on the stage, leading the audience to recollect with deep emotion the course in which South Hamgyong Province advanced in the van of the era under the leadership of Kim Jong Il.
					
					 The concert imbued the audience with the ardent wishes of the dear respected Kim Jong Un that the province would fulfill its obligation as soldiers and disciples of Kim Jong Il who invariably trusted and projected its workers as vanguard fighters in economic construction.
					
					 The performance goes on.

articles.title: Music and Dance Performance Goes on
articles.content:
Music and Dance Performance Goes on
 Pyongyang, January 17 (KCNA) -- A music and dance performance "Let Us Uphold Our Supreme Commander Forever" is going on before full house at the April 25 House of Culture everyday. 
					 The performance staged on Tuesday mesmerized the audience as it fully demonstrated the militant spirit of the powerful revolutionary army of Mt. Paektu and its ideological and mental traits.
					
					 After the playing of the national anthem, the performers and audience paid silent tribute in humble reverence to General Secretary Kim Jong Il.
					
					 The performance began with the immortal revolutionary hymn "Song of General Kim Jong Il".
					
					 Put on the stage were colorful numbers including band music and mixed chorus "Comrade Kim Jong Il Is Our Supreme Commander", female solo and mixed pangchang  "Where Are You, Dear General?", an immortal masterpiece, and mixed chorus "Might of Korea."
					
					 Whenever the noble images of Kim Jong Il making endless journeys to inspect the front day and night, leaving legends about love were projected on the stage background in succession, the audiences burst into loud applause, overcome with deep emotion.
					
					 Tears were seen rolling down the cheeks of the audience when mixed chorus "Boundless Is Yearning" was reverberated. This song reflected the ardent yearning of all people across the country for Kim Jong Il. 
					
					 Its repertoire also included male trio "The Country I Am Defending", tap dance "Let Us Keep Pace to the Tune of Army Song", male vocal solo and male chorus "Song of Comradeship", male chorus "Leader, Just Give Us Your Order", narrative poem "Oh Korea, Tell the Story" and songs "Footstep" and "We Will Safeguard General Kim Jong Un with Our Lives."
					
					 The performance was acclaimed by the audience for its high ideological value and artistry.

articles.title: Delegation of Academy of Agricultural Science Back Home
articles.content:
Delegation of Academy of Agricultural Science Back Home
 Pyongyang, January 17 (KCNA) -- The delegation of the Academy of Agricultural Science headed by its President Kye Yong Sam came back home on Jan. 17 after visiting Guinea to attend celebrations of the 30th anniversary of the Kim Il Sung Institute of Agricultural Science in Guinea.

articles.title: Revolutionary Poems Produced
articles.content:
Revolutionary Poems Produced
 Pyongyang, January 17 (KCNA) -- Dozens of poems were produced in the DPRK.
					 The poems deal with the revolutionary life and feats of General Secretary Kim Jong Il and the ardent faith of the Korean People's Army and the people to remain boundlessly loyal to the leadership of the dear respected Kim Jong Un, true to his instruction.
					
					 Poems "Let us show love for the General's country", "The red flag represents our oath" and "May our burning hearts answer" deal with the intense loyalty to glorify the history of Kim Jong Il's immortality for all ages to fulfill their oath taken during the mourning.
					
					The poems "Looking up to flag of Supreme Commander", "The first step of the Supreme Commander", "He is our supreme commander" and others fully reflect the excitement and joy over having the dear respected Kim Jong Un as the supreme commander of the revolutionary armed forces.
					
					Poems "Forward, keeping pace with great brilliant commander!", "May great country of the sun tower higher" and others deal with the pledge to steadily carry forward the march of Mt. Paektu under the leadership of the respected Supreme Commander and demonstrate the might of the country over which the Songun Sun is  shining.
					
					 Among the new poems are "May Country put forward this soldier" depicting the revolutionary spirit of a-match-for-a hundred soldiers and "We will spread silk with flower-patterns of all blessings" reflecting the proud appearance of the workers in the field of light industry.

articles.title: Kim Hyong Jik University of Education Takes on New Look
articles.content:
Kim Hyong Jik University of Education Takes on New Look
 Pyongyang, January 17 (KCNA) -- Kim Hyong Jik University of Education is undergoing a renovation as required by the new century.
					 The renovation project has been undertaken by servicepersons from June Juche 100 (2011).
					
					 They pulled down old buildings and removed earth as much as tens of thousands of cubic meters in less than two months. 
					
					 They are also rebuilding the gatepost of the university's main entrance to hang up the tablet "Kim Hyong Jik University of Education" autographed by President Kim Il Sung.
					
					 The frame assembling of five-storeyed and nine-storeyed buildings and library have already been completed.
					
					 The interior plastering and installation of geothermal equipment for air-conditioning the buildings are near completion.
					
					 A progress is also made in the reconstruction of the cultural center and gymnasium of the university and in readjustment of the campus.
					
					 With the renovation project making a good headway, the university is taking on a new look.
					
					 Yun Chan Uk, vice-rector of the university, told KCNA that after the project the university will assume a completely new appearance befitting a centre of training educators.

articles.title: Crown Made with Artificial Diamond
articles.content:
Crown Made with Artificial Diamond 
 Pyongyang, January 17 (KCNA) -- Korea has succeeded in manufacturing crowns with artificial diamond in the country.
					 The crown minimizes the waste of diamond particles during drilling and can be used without readjustment for a long time.
					
					 Unmovably fastened to the drill, it ensures a stable operation of the machine.
					
					 Its drilling speed is 1.3 times faster than the crown made with natural diamond in quartz granite and hornstone, whose rock intensity is 9 to 10, while its serviceable life is 5 times longer.
					
					 Local prospecting teams have already begun to use the home-made crown.
					
					 Its developer at the Mechanical Engineering Institute told KCNA:
					
					 "With the newly-developed crown beginning to be used, drilling technologies have been put on a scientific and standardized basis. A production base of the crown has also been built in the country."

articles.title: Those Who Hurt Dignity of DPRK Supreme Leadership Deserve Severest Punishment: KCNA
articles.content:
Those Who Hurt Dignity of DPRK Supreme Leadership Deserve Severest Punishment: KCNA
 Pyongyang, January 17 (KCNA) -- One month has passed since General Secretary Kim Jong Il, the great father of the nation and loadstar of national reunification, passed away all of sudden to the sorrow of the service personnel and people of the DPRK.
					 In this period, the tears shed by all Koreans formed a veritable sea and their lamentation shook mountains and rivers.
					
					 The whole world shared sorrow with the Korean people over the demise of Kim Jong Il, a great guardian of justice. Personages of many countries expressed deep condolences over his demise irrespective of ideology, political view, nationality and religious belief.
					
					 However, it was only the Lee Myung Bak group of traitors that perpetrated thrice-cursed treasons during the mourning over the great loss to the nation.
					
					 What is more serious is that the group did not hesitate to insult the great father of the Korean nation.
					
					 It worked hard by all means and methods to prevent progressive forces and people from all walks life in south Korea from using the word "demise" in their messages of condolences. It also made public a statement peppered with unspeakable insolent words which can be used only by coldhearted guys.
					
					 It hurled the right-wing conservative organizations into areas along the front to scatter leaflets hurting the sacred dignity of the DPRK several times.
					
					 It cried out for "taking counter-action by separating people from the leadership of the north." Not content with this, the group imprudently shifted the "final blame" for "Cheonan" warship case and Yonphyong island shelling incident onto the supreme leadership of the DPRK. The group blustered it would never officially express condolences.
					
					 This is the most serious provocation to the DPRK.
					
					The DPRK has already solemnly declared that it regards the insult to its supreme leadership as vital as life as the worst crime.
					
					 However, the south Korean puppet group staged military exercises, setting the supreme headquarters of the DPRK as targets. Not content with this, it committed such traitorous crime against ethics as insulting it during the mourning over the great loss to the Korean nation.
					
					The DPRK will never pardon these crimes through generations.
					
					 The Lee group is a gang of worst political hooligans and depraved guys.
					
					 The group's serious insult to the supreme leadership of the DPRK resulted in completely severing the inter-Korean relations. 
					
					 The resentment of the army and people of the DPRK at the group of traitors has run to the sky.
					
					 The group will not be able to escape the severest punishment.

articles.title: KCNA Ridicules U.S. Trumpeting about "Nuclear-Free World"
articles.content:
KCNA Ridicules U.S. Trumpeting about "Nuclear-Free World"
 Pyongyang, January 17 (KCNA) -- It was recently disclosed that the United States has continued its secret nuclear weapons test, stunning the world. 
					 The Kyodo News reported on Jan. 6 that the U.S. conducted a plutonium test based on new technology in order to examine the power of the stockpiled nuclear weapons last summer.
					
					 This brought to light the hypocritical and deceptive nature of the U.S. administration's commitment to prohibiting the development of nukes and nuclear tests.
					
					 The incumbent chief executive of the U.S. has vociferously called for building "a world without nuclear weapons" since he came to power. For this he was awarded even the Nobel Peace Prize.
					
					 But, the U.S. has conducted nuclear tests more often and in a craftier manner during his office, bringing up their destructive power to an unimaginable level. 
					
					 The U.S. has put spurs to the modernization of nuclear weapons.
					
					 When a budget for fiscal 2011 was being shaped, the administration asked the Congress to approve an expenditure of more than 7 billion dollars for nuke-related activities of the Nuclear Security Agency or 624 million more than the previous year.
					
					 A U.S. nuclear scientist said in this connection that there has never been such increase in fund for nuke-related activities since the early period of the Reagan administration.
					
					 Even U.S. media chided the present government for contemplating increasing funds for nuclear weapon research projects talking about "nuclear non-proliferation" and "denuclearization".
					
					 The U.S. keeps deploying nuclear weapons in different regions of the world and escalating the danger of a nuclear war on the Korean Peninsula.
					
					 The reality goes to prove that the U.S. nuclear policy for aggression can never change, no matter who becomes its president.
					
					 It is the invariable strategy of the U.S. to dominate the world by monopolizing nuclear weapons and holding hegemony in the field of strategic offensive weapons.
					
					 There can be neither non-use of nukes nor their dismantlement for the U.S. which regards nuclear weapons as all-powerful means for executing its policy of aggression.
					
					 It has not dropped its nuclear policy even a single day but increased the production of nukes and expanded their proliferation since it inflicted the first nuclear disaster upon humankind.
					
					 It has spent a huge amount of funds for the modernization of nukes and transferred nuclear technology to its allies, posing nuclear threats to its rivals and anti-imperialist independent countries.
					
					 It still remains the arch criminal which has posed nuclear war threats to the world and sparked an arms race.
					
					 The U.S. is the world's biggest possessor of nuclear weapons. It was the first in the world to transfer nuclear weapon technology. 
					
					 The "denuclearization" touted by the U.S. is, in essence, aimed at preventing all other countries and regions from having access to nuclear weapons. In other words, it is a doctrine for monopolizing nukes. 
					
					 It is, therefore, preposterous and shameless sophism for the U.S. to call for "building a nuclear-free world" as it considers nuclear strategy as a mainstay of its national policy.
					
					 The U.S. would be well advised to stop making a mockery of the international community and give up its nuclear ambition.

articles.title: Minju Joson S. Korean Minister of Unification's Rigmaroles Slammed
articles.content:
Minju Joson S. Korean Minister of Unification's Rigmaroles Slammed
 Pyongyang, January 17 (KCNA) -- The DPRK declared that it would never deal with the traitors' group. As regards this declaration, Ryu U Ik, puppet minister of Unification of south Korea, uttered it was "regretful" and "accusation distorting the good will." He went the lengths of impudently advising the north to "make a good choice rather than a bad one." Touring here and there, he talked nonsense about "building of a channel of dialogue" and "unlimited consultation." 
					 Minju Joson Tuesday observes in a bylined commentary in this regard: 
					
					 By what he uttered he meant south Korea expressed "good will" during the mourning over the big loss to the nation and it still stands for inter-Korean dialogue and improved relations. These are nothing but jargons let loose by the puppet gang which defies any criticism and feels unashamed. 
					
					 The commentary says:
					
					 Ryu U Ik issued a statement to the effect that the authorities would not express official condolences and disallow any condolatory visit by people of various strata except Ri Hui Ho, widow of Kim Dae Jung, former president of south Korea, and Hyon Jong Un, chairwoman of the Hyundai Group of south Korea. When the widow of the former president Roh Moo Hyun, expressed her intention to pay a similar visit, he insisted he could not allow it, claiming it was not a "return visit." He barred political parties, organizations and people of all social strata of south Korea from paying condolatory visits under the pretext that "they were contrary to principle" and "division of the national opinion". Moreover, the gentry of his ministry even prevented members of the south side in the Kaesong Industrial Zone from visiting the mourning station and deleted such expressions as "demise, condolences and mourning" from the condolatory messages of south Koreans to the north. 
					
					 Ryu seeks to mislead the public opinion at home and abroad with plausible words, describing the group's crimes against ethics as "good will".
					
					 These crimes committed by the group have already brought the north-south relations to a total collapse. Clearly stating once again, the service personnel and people of the DPRK will never deal with the group of traitors, no matter how vociferously it may trumpet about "building of a channel of dialogue" and "unlimited consultation".

articles.title: Minju Joson Japan Accused of More Zealously Toeing U.S. Policy
articles.content:
Minju Joson Japan Accused of More Zealously Toeing U.S. Policy
 Pyongyang, January 17 (KCNA) -- The Japanese defence minister was reported recently to have extolled his master U.S. to the sky, uttering "Japan would like to properly approach its new defence strategy and welcome it as there is no change in its stance of giving priority to the Asia-Pacific Region".
					 Minju Joson Tuesday observes in a signed commentary in this regard:
					
					 Japan is impatient for inviting the U.S. to meddle in regional issues. Lurking behind its stand of toeing the U.S. policy is its calculation to realize its wild ambition for emerging a military power and launch reinvasion with the U.S. backing. 
					
					 Japan offered the U.S. its whole territory as a sortie base and logistic base for a war so that the latter may realize its strategy for dominating Asia.
					
					 Japan is covered with a dense network of U.S. military bases. 
					
					 Japan feigns ignorance of the frequent port calls of U.S. warships with nuclear weapons on board.
					
					 Not content with this, Japan is considering offering even its civilian ports to the U.S. under the absurd pretext of "contingency" on the Korean Peninsula. 
					
					 Japan is now rapidly reorganizing its state machinery into a reasonable form for carrying out its policy of war.
					
					 It was disclosed recently that a working group of the Democratic Party of Japan finished the framework of a "draft recommendation" for establishing the Japanese version of the National Security Council. 
					
					 It is the calculation of Japan to decide on major military affairs at the "National Security Council" without going through complicated procedures and rush headlong towards militarist war of aggression overseas. 
					
					 The DPRK can never remain an onlooker to the danger of war increasing in Northeast Asia by Japan. 
					
					 Japan would be well advised to give up its ambition for overseas expansion and behave with discretion.

articles.title: South Korean Authorities Accused of their Measures for Firing Workers
articles.content:
South Korean Authorities Accused of their Measures for Firing Workers
 Pyongyang, January 17 (KCNA) -- More than 5 000 citizens and members of trade unions of Ssangyong, Hyundai and Kia Motorcar Plants of south Korea on Jan. 13 held a rally in front of the Ssangyong motorcar factory in Phyongthaek, Kyonggi Province in protest against the murderous dismissal step of the puppet authorities under the pretext of restructuring.
					 The speakers at the rally said the most ardent desire of the workers is to live in society free from dismissal under the pretext of restructuring and part-time job.
					
					 They declared that to express anger is not enough but it is necessary to launch a vigorous struggle to have their right to work guaranteed through a high-intensity struggle including strike.
					
					 They called for making this year a year for putting an end to the authorities' man-killing policy of dismissal.

articles.title: Explosion Sinks Cargo Ship
articles.content:
Explosion Sinks Cargo Ship
 Pyongyang, January 17 (KCNA) -- A cargo ship sank by an explosion 3 miles off north of Jawol island of Inchon, south Korea on Jan. 15, according to south Korean MBC.
					 Among the crew on board 5 were dead and some were missing.

articles.title: Profound Mourning of Compatriots in North over Demise of Kim Jong Il
articles.content:
Profound Mourning of Compatriots in North over Demise of Kim Jong Il
 Pyongyang, January 17 (KCNA) -- Overseas compatriots visited the homeland to express condolences over the demise of General Secretary Kim Jong Il. Upon their return, they held a meeting in Los Angels at which they noted they were shocked to see compatriots shedding bitter tears over the loss of the father of the nation. 
					 Jaju Minbo, an internet paper of south Korea, on Jan. 14 said: "The scenes of compatriots in the north mourning and wailing were unprecedented in world history.  Those who witnessed these unbelievable scenes said that their feelings were true, flatly rejecting some media's misinformation that 'they were orchestrated' and 'forced sorrow'".
					
					 Dr. Yang Un Sik, permanent chairman of the U.S. Regional Committee of the Oversea Side Committee for Implementing June 15 Joint Declaration, said that "all the Koreans were in such profound sorrow and grief that the land of the north seemed to have turned into a huge sea of wailing and lamenting people. During the mourning period the whole north was swept by waves of mourning events reminiscent of seas of people in bitter grief and tears".
					
					 "Their deep sorrow and grief were a clear proof of their true respect and reverence for their leader. I read reports of some media that those scenes were orchestrated and the like. But I returned after confirming that they were diametrically contrary to truth. It is my feeling that still I cannot forget even a moment compatriots so bitterly weeping over his demise". 
					
					Hyon Jun Gi said:
					
					"I got an opportunity to know a large family system through my condolatory visit to the north. This means I witnessed the single-minded unity. Visiting the homeland, I learned in detail that the DPRK turned into a large family thanks to President Kim Il Sung.
					
					 "I came back after seeing compatriots in the north sincerely respect and revere their leader and bitterly grieve his passing, regarding him as the father of a family. These were the true feelings of fellow countrymen in the north. Nowhere we could see those scenes were false. The common viewpoint of those who visited the north is that the people in the north are strong in their self-respect and, at the same time, modest and simple. By saying so, we mean they do not tell lies. Those who slander them, terming their lamentation and tears as orchestrated deserve punishment."
					
					 Ro Kil Nam who covered Pyongyang as correspondent of Minjok Thongshin said: "I watched compatriots in the north covering paved roads in Yongung and Chollima streets with mufflers and overcoats so that the car carrying the bier of Chairman Kim Jong Il might not pass snow-covered roads during the day of bidding last farewell to him.  I came to know the fact once again that this is the relations of love between the leader and the people, the relations of believing in people as in Heaven, comradely obligation, the revolutionary obligation and, at the same time,  the might of the society in the north. Such relations are the source of 'single-minded unity' stronger than any nuclear weapon.
					
					 "Most of officials are abstaining from drinking wine usually liked by them though the mourning period was over. Hearing them say they decided to abstain from drinking for a year to come, I asked myself have there been in human history such close relations between the leader and the members of the society.
					
					 "The conclusion is that no one in the world could and will be able to find such a society where the leader and people have become one as the society in the north." 
					
					 Jong Ki Ryol, visiting professor of Qinghua University of China, noted:
					
					 "Biting cold subsided and cold wind stopped in Pyongyang from Dec. 27, a day before the date of bidding last farewell to the leader. The snow that fell all night went on till the ceremony which started at 2 p.m. Both sky and land seemed to wail".
					
					 "On Dec. 28, 2011, the day of bidding last farewell to NDC Chairman Kim Jong Il, the sky of Pyongyang shook with lamentation and grief, sorrow and wail. I asked myself has human history ever witnessed such grand epic of beautiful love of Koreans in the north hard to express with any spoken and written languages as it baffled human imagination and difficult to describe without tears."

articles.title: Joint New Year Editorial Supported by Koreans in U.S.
articles.content:
Joint New Year Editorial Supported by Koreans in U.S.
 Pyongyang, January 17 (KCNA) -- A spokesman for the Federation of Koreans in the U.S. made public a statement on Jan. 14 in support of the joint New Year editorial in the DPRK.
					 The statement said that the joint editorial calls for bringing about a decisive turn in accomplishing the cause of national reunification under the slogan "Let all the compatriots open the gates of national reunification full of fresh confidence!"
					
					 The north has made positive efforts to open a new phase for independent reunification but the Lee Myung Bak "government" of south Korea defied them, bringing the inter-Korean relations to a total collapse by pursuing such hostile policy toward the DPRK as confrontation with fellow countrymen and war moves, the statement noted, and went on:
					
					 The Lee regime is, indeed, a group of war maniacs opposed to reunification as it stands in the way of national reunification, the ardent desire of all Koreans.
					
					 The Lee regime should no longer resort to dangerous military provocations in reliance upon the U.S, it urged.
					
					 Fully supporting the joint editorial which calls for making a breakthrough towards independent reunification this year, the Federation said that it would wage a more vigorous struggle for national reunification in unity with all patriotic forces at home and abroad under the uplifted banner of "By the Korean nation itself".

articles.title: Kim Jong Un's Leadership Guarantees All Victories: Communist Party of Chile
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un's Leadership Guarantees All Victories: Communist Party of Chile
 Pyongyang, January 17 (KCNA) -- The leadership of Kim Jong Un, supreme commander of the Korean People's Army, guarantees all victories. The Communist Party of Chile said this in a statement published on Jan. 5 in support of the joint New Year editorial of the DPRK.
					 The joint editorial of the DPRK serves as important guidelines for successfully accomplishing the cause of General Secretary Kim Jong Il as it praises the great exploits he performed for the country and revolution, the statement noted, and continued: It also serves as a banner of struggle for the progressive people aspiring after socialism as it clearly indicates the way to be followed by the Korean people for the prosperity of their country.
					
					 The Korean people will continue dynamically advancing along the road indicated by President Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il.

articles.title: Joint New Year Editorial Introduced by Mexican Organizations
articles.content:
Joint New Year Editorial Introduced by Mexican Organizations
 Pyongyang, January 17 (KCNA) -- The Mexican Committee for the Study of Kimilsungism and the Mexican Institute for the Study of the Juche Idea issued bulletins Nos. 65 and 86 dealing with the main contents of the joint New Year editorial of Rodong Sinmun, Joson Inmingun and Chongnyon Jonwi, leading papers of the DPRK.
					 The bulletins carried photos of Pyongyang.

articles.title: Youth in Capitalist Countries Torn with Corruption and Despair
articles.content:
Youth in Capitalist Countries Torn with Corruption and Despair
 Pyongyang, January 17 (KCNA) -- Last year alone, a large number of young people in capitalist countries were thrown into a cesspool of crimes, a product of corrupt society.
					 At the beginning of last year, a 22 year-old young man in Arizona, U.S. indiscriminately fired at a crowd of people who had gathered in front of a department store for a meeting, leaving about 20 people dead or injured.
					
					 It was disclosed that a young man in his twenties strangled a 3-year-old child to death before throwing him on a riverbank in Kumamoto Prefecture, Japan early in March.
					
					 Drug trafficking and its use have become more rampant in the capitalist countries, becoming a malign tumor as they leave young people depraved morally and physically.
					
					 The European Commission, quoting a survey, said 16 percent of the younger generation of Ireland are using drug.
					
					 Another serious problem facing the capitalist countries is the steady increase of young unemployed owing to the consequences of economic and financial crises. 
					
					 The EU Statistics Bureau recently said the number of unemployed young people reached 5.6 million in its member states in November last year.
					
					 In Italy the number of unemployed people under the age of 35 reached 1.138 million as of August last year. In Spain one of three unemployed is a young man.
					
					 In Britain, young jobless people stood at 1.027 million as of late October last year. The youth in the capitalist countries are cursing their corrupt societies without any hope and in despair.
					
					 This is evidenced by a nationwide opinion poll conducted among young people in Greece early in December last year. 
					
					 According to it, 6 of 10 respondents said they would like to leave Greece, pessimistic about the prospect of their country in the grip of a serious debt crisis. 
					
					 The above-said facts go to clearly prove that a capitalist society has no future and is bound to go to ruin.

articles.title: Gloomy Prospect of Capitalist World in New Year
articles.content:
Gloomy Prospect of Capitalist World in New Year
 Pyongyang, January 17 (KCNA) -- Various kinds of crimes have taken place in capitalist countries in an unbroken chain at the outset of the new year as they happened last year, throwing people into great uneasiness and horror.
					 According to VOA, as many as over 40 arsons had occurred in residential areas centering around Hollywood District in Los Angeles, California State from Dec. 29 last year to Jan. 1 this year.
					
					 At a time when huge material losses were caused and horror-stricken atmosphere prevailed in the city due to ceaseless arsons four people were shot to death by an unidentified criminal on the outskirts of San Diego City, on Jan. 1.
					
					 Horrible murder cases broke out in other capitalist countries including Japan and Britain before and after the New Year.
					
					 The ever-deepening unemployment crisis is adding to the worries and sufferings of the toiling masses in the capitalist countries in the new year, too.
					
					 The Boeing company on Jan. 4 announced its plan to fire 2 000 employees under the pretext of worsening business.
					
					 On Jan. 9 harbor workers of seven ports of Portugal went on a strike demanding stable jobs.
					
					 As a result of serious joblessness, an increasing number of people are forced to live below the poverty line.
					
					 According to a survey of the Census Bureau of the U.S., the number of the poverty-stricken people reached 49.1 million across the country till the end of last year.
					
					 In Greece the number of such people reached more than 2.2 million.
					
					 The same is the case with other capitalist countries.
					
					 Over 4.4 million toiling people in Spain and 2.78 million in Germany saw out last year and greeted gloomy New Year, their right to work denied.
					
					 As seen above, 2012 is a year without any hope for future for the toiling masses in the capitalist society.

articles.title: U.S. Impudent Interference under Fire
articles.content:
U.S. Impudent Interference under Fire 
Pyongyang, January 17 (KCNA) -- Slovenia and the United States are involved in growing disputes after U.S. ambassador to Slovenia Joseph Mussomeli was alleged to have offered himself as mediator in talks on the new government coalition in the country.
					Mussomeli reportedly had met all party leaders in Slovenian legislature over the ongoing coalition talks.
					
					Local commercial broadcaster POP TV quoted the ambassador as saying that it would be nice if a coalition representing the majority, if not all Slovenians, could be formed. 
					
					The government and political circles of Slovenia said that Mussomeli had "trespassed the basic rules and the boundaries of his term as a diplomat."
					
					In response to the media reports, Slovenian President Danilo Turk and outgoing Foreign Minister Samuel Zbogar labeled Mussomeli's words and actions as "unnecessary and inappropriate."
					
					Boris Frlec, former Slovenian foreign minister, and Jozef Kunic, head of the Slovenian Foreign Policy Association, also criticized Mussomeli's actions as "inadmissible" and "detrimental to Slovenia's international reputation."
					
					"I wonder whether the ambassador should be sent to a diplomatic practice course. Meddling in the internal affairs of a country where you are a guest as an ambassador is inappropriate and unacceptable," the STA quoted Frlec as reporting.
					
					Vinko Gorenak, deputy of the Slovenian Democrats, said "we will form coalitions in Slovenia on our own and not with the U.S. ambassador." 
					
					Mussomeli insisted he was misunderstood.
					
					But, the degree of denunciation and protests of Slovenians against the U.S. ambassador is gaining in scope and strength through newspapers and broadcasting services of this country.

articles.title: Russian FM Warns Japanese Authorities

Russian FM Warns Japanese Authorities
 Moscow, January 16 (KCNA) -- The Foreign Ministry of Russia in a statement on Jan. 14 warned the Japanese authorities over the issue of Southern Kuriles.

If this was aimed at bringing into bold relief the stand of Japan unacceptable to Russia, it would not be helpful to improving the Russia-Japan relations, the statement warned.

articles.title: Russia Rejects Any Military Operation against Iran
articles.content:
Russia Rejects Any Military Operation against Iran
 Moscow, January 16 (KCNA) -- Vice-Minister of Foreign Affairs of Russia Sergei Lyavkov in a recent interview with ITAR-TASS clarified the stand of his country resolutely rejecting any military operation against Iran.
					 He warned the operation against Iran would be the gravest mistake and the worst calculation on the part of the West.
					
					 The issue of Iran's nuclear program can never be settled by military means and its consequences will be very disastrous for the regional and world security, he added.
					
					 And it will deal a heavy blow at the world economy and upset international relations, he noted, stressing that Russia can never allow this.

articles.title: Otorgada Orden de Amistad de la RPDC a consejero chino
articles.content:
Otorgada Orden de Amistad de la RPDC a consejero chino
Pyongyang, 17 de enero (ACNC) -- La Orden de Amistad de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea fue conferida al consejero de la Embajada de la Republica Popular China en Corea, Miao Weicheng.
					La ceremonia de otorgamiento tuvo lugar el dia 17 en el capitalino Palacio de los Congresos Mansudae.
					
					En la ocasion estuvieron presentes el vicepresidente del Presidium de la Asamblea Popular Suprema, Yang Hyong Sop, el subjefe de departamento del Comite Central del Partido del Trabajo de Corea, Kim Song Nam, y otros funcionarios, el embajador Liu Hongcai y otros miembros de la embajada china.
					
					Despues de leido el decreto correspondiente del Presidium de la APS, fue concedida la Orden de Amistad de segunda clase a Miao quien hizo aporte al fortalecimiento de las tradicionales relaciones de amistad y cooperacion Corea-China en acato al noble proposito de los maximos dirigentes de ambos paises.

articles.title: IRP publica informacion sobre clima de pesar en Sur de Corea y ultramar
articles.content:
IRP publica informacion sobre clima de pesar en Sur de Corea y ultramar
Pyongyang, 17 de enero (ACNC) -- El Instituto de la Reunificacion de la Patria (IRP) hizo publica el dia 16 una informacion para dar a conocer al interior y al exterior del pais el clima de recordacion al Dirigente Kim Jong Il dado en el Sur de Corea y la comunidad coreana en ultramar durante el gran duelo nacional.
					Su texto resumido sigue:
					
					Al mediodia del dia 19 de diciembre del ano pasado, se publico el comunicado sobre el fallecimiento del Dirigente Kim Jong Il, el cual dejo consternados el Sur de Corea y todo el mundo.
					
					Internet, TV y otros medios del Sur de Corea se hicieron eco de esa noticia tan triste.
					
					Quedaron cancelados las funciones y otros actos programados con motivo de la Navidad y el Ano Nuevo.
					
					A una hora despues de transmitido el comunicado especial de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, en los 5 sitios web mas famosos del Sur de Corea se divulgaron mas de 120 mil articulos de recordacion bajo titulares de "Estamos muy entristecidos por el fallecimiento del Presidente del Comite de Defensa Nacional", "Lo sentimos mucho, compartiremos la tristeza", "Deseamos gloria al Presidente del CDN", "Quedara eternamente en el corazon del pueblo el noble espiritu del Presidente del CDN, Sol de la nacion" y "General Kim Jong Il sera elogiado en todo el curso de la historia de humanidad".
					
					Los coreanos en ultramar, muy adoloridos por la perdida del Padre de la nacion, telefonearon o mandaron telegramas a la patria enfatizando que no pueden creer esa noticia triste.
					
					Los habitantes surcoreanos y los compatriotas en ultramar recordaron la noble vida, la noble personalidad y las imborrables hazanas del Dirigente Kim Jong Il.
					
					Los medios de prensa divulgaron reportajes especiales sobre la biografia del Dirigente junto con su retrato con amplia sonrisa y las fotos alusivas a su vida revolucionaria.
					
					El periodico online del Sur de Corea Jaju Minbo y otros medios progresistas subrayaron que "Aunque fallecio el Presidente del CDN Kim Jong Il, heroe de la epoca y gran estrella, seran eternos junto con la historia su espiritu y hazanas".
					
					Haciendo enfasis en que el Dirigente continuo hasta los ultimos dias de su vida la marcha forzada de orientacion en el terreno y fallecio en el tren en pleno viaje de trabajo, elogiaron su modo de direccion como "marcha amplia y larga" y "direccion a modo de relampago" realizadas con el "espiritu de inmolarse trabajando" nunca visto en ningun otro lider del mundo.
					
					Los habitantes de distintos sectores del Sur de Corea senalaron que el Presidente del CDN         Kim Jong Il preparo la cumbre Norte-Sur y aprobo las declaraciones Norte-Sur para dar a la nacion coreana la reunificacion, lo cual es la gran empresa  que se transmitira siempre en la historia de la nacion. 
					
					Y se impacientaron diciendo que bueno seria si hubiera vivido el Presidente del CDN para llevar a la practica la Declaracion Conjunta del 15 de Junio y la Declaracion del 4 de Octubre.
					
					Quienes se habian reunido con el Dirigente recordaron con emocion al gran Hombre sin par lamentandose mas.
					
					Los medios de prensa del Sur de Corea transmitieron tal como son los contenidos de recordacion de los lideres y personalidades de varios paises del mundo.
					
					  Ellos elogiaron al Dirigente como gran estratega incomparable con nadie, como hombre quien maneja libremente la destreza y la politica atrevidas e imprevisibles, como persona logica, como hombre quien emite la poderosa energia, como hombre de gran talento que tiene abundantes temas de conversacion sobre varias ramas, como dirigente atractivo que contiene la fuerza, chiste y divinidad.
					
					Los coreanos residentes en ultramar editaron en Internet y publicaciones con la infinita anoranza al padre de la nacion los articulos en memoria de este intitulados "el Presidente Kim Jong Il y el destino de la patria", "lagrimas de los compatriotas en noche avanzada", "visita de condolencias de los compatriotas", etc.
					
					El alma de los habitantes de distintos sectores del Sur de Corea y  compatriotas en ultramar en memoria del Dirigente se manifestaron fervientemente en las expresiones y visitas de condolencias.
					
					Una vez publicada la informacion especial, el Partido Unido Democratico, el Partido Progresista Unido y otros partidos opositores del Sur de Corea organizaron simultaneamente las conferencias de prensa, ocasiones en las cuales hicieron publicas las declaraciones, comentarios y otros para expresar el profundo pesame por el fallecimiento de Kim Jong Il.
					
					El Comite Sureno para la Ejecucion de la Declaracion Conjunta del 15 de Junio, la sede de la parte surena de la Alianza Pannacional por la Reunificacion de la Patria,  la Confederacion de Sindicatos Surcoreanos (CSS), la Federacion de Sindicatos Surcoreanos (FSS) y otras numerosas entidades de distintos sectores hicieron llegar los mensajes de condolencias en senal de profundo pesame.
					
					Durante el periodo del duelo nacional, los partidos politicos, las organizaciones de movimiento por la reunificacion, las entidades civiles, sociales y religiosas y distintas personalidades enviaron oficial y extraoficialmente miles de mensajes de condolencias en senal de profundo pesame por el fallecimiento de Kim Jong Il, y el Ministerio titere de Reunificacion publico oficialmente que ha recibido 77  mensajes de condolencias.
					
					Los distintos sectores surcoreanos se dirigieron a Pyongyang formando los grupos de visita de condolencias.
					
					Ri Hui Ho, viuda del ex presidente surcoreano Kim Dae Jung, y Hyon Jong Un, presidenta del Grupo Hyundai, y sus comitivas vinieron a Pyongyang cruzando la linea de demarcacion militar para expresar condolencias ante el feretro de Kim Jong Il.
					
					Hwang Hye Ro, co-representante de la Solidaridad por la Reunificacion Independiente y la Democracia del Sur de Corea visito Pyongyang arriesgando su vida  para rendir tributo ante el feretro del Dirigente, padre de la nacion.
					
					Las entidades civiles y sociales del Sur de Corea organizaron por cuenta propia el grupo de condolencias y presentaron al Ministerio de Reunificacion la solicitud de visita al Norte. Los familiares del ex presidente surcoreano Roh Moo Hyun y del pastor Mun Ik Hwan demandaron tambien el permiso a la visita de condolencias.
					
					Entre tanto, los partidos opositores exigieron al "gobierno" que autorice el envio del grupo de condolencias de la "Asamblea Nacional" si no quiere mandar uno de nivel gubernamental. Para el caso de que el "gobierno" tampoco permita la visita de parlamentarios a Pyongyang, demandaron que aceptara el envio de un grupo civil en nombre del Consejo Pannacional por la Reconciliacion y la Cooperacion de la Nacion.
					
					La banda del traidor Lee Myung Bak desestimo todas esas peticiones, por el contrario, reprimio salvajemente a los que intentaron expresar condolencias.
					
					Los habitantes surcoreanos tuvieron que hacer una lucha por expresar condolencias instalando en distintas partes los altares de incensacion. Frente a la represion, abrieron el "altar cibernetico" para expresar condolencias por via de Internet.
					
					Los grupos de los coreanos en ultramar y los compatriotas individuales tomaron un largo viaje con destino a Pyongyang y expresaron las mas sentidas condolencias ante el feretro de Kim Jong Il.
					
					Las organizaciones de los compatriotas en ultramar constituyeron los comites de recordacion que organizaron durante el duelo nacional la visita de condolencias a las embajadas coreanas en respectivos paises, la publicacion de mensajes y declaraciones de pesame y el acto de recordacion.
					
					Son mas de 500 las cartas y los mensajes de condolencias enviados por las entidades de coreanos residentes en China, EE.UU., Rusia y otros paises del mundo y los individuos.
					
					El clima de pesar generado en distintos sectores  del Sur de Corea y la comunidad coreana en ultramar fue el mas sincero, calido e indetenible.
					
					Por otra parte, los medios surcoreanos informaron que el Norte cuenta con el Vicepresidente de la Comision Militar Central del Partido del Trabajo de Corea Kim Jong Un, igual al Presidente del CDN, y que el mundo ya lo reconocio como Maximo Dirigente de Corea.
					
					Ante la unidad monolitica en Corea demostrada durante las ceremonias de condolencias y de despedida, los surcoreanos y compatriotas en ultramar se quedaron muy conmovidos.
					
					El periodico surcoreano Jaju Minbo cito asi el articulo del corresponsal de Minjok Thongsin, medio de los compatriotas residentes en Estados Unidos:
					
					"Los habitantes norcoreanos, que despedian al Presidente del CDN Kim Jong Il, daban una escena mas impresionante que ha conocido la historia de la humanidad. Se veian los ciudadanos que cubrian con sus bufandas y abrigos el camino donde pasaria la carroza funebre para protegerlo de la nevada y los otros que limpiaban desconsolados la via.
					
					En este planeta no hay otro pais como este en que el lider y el pueblo forman una familia de absoluta confianza y ayuda reciproca y el segundo respeta y venera en tal grado al primero. Aqui esta la clave de la inimitable unidad monolitica que disuade a cualquier potencia."
					
					El periodico online surcoreano Surprise reporto como sigue: "La unidad monolitica entre el lider y el pueblo, la increible realidad de la RPDC donde todo el pais forma una familia, las almas que conocen unicamente a su lider, su partido y su patria: estos son el aspecto verdadero de la RPDC y el factor de su gran poderio."
					
					Todos los datos arriba mencionados hacen sentir una vez mas la grandeza del Dirigente Kim Jong Il quien era el Sol y padre para la nacion coreana.

articles.title: Aprobada ley de administracion de semillas de cultivos en Corea
articles.content:
Aprobada ley de administracion de semillas de cultivos en Corea
Pyongyang, 17 de enero (ACNC) -- Segun el decreto del Presidium de la Asamblea Popular Suprema de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea fechado 14 de diciembre del 100 (2011) de la Era Juche fue aprobada la ley de administracion de semillas de cultivos en Corea.
					  La ley consta de 5 capitulos (la esencia de la ley de administracion de semillas de cultivos, el registro de semillas de cultivos, la produccion de semillas de cultivos, la conservacion y el uso de semillas de cultivos, la direccion y el control del trabajo de administracion de semillas de cultivos) y 43 articulos.
					
					  Gracias a la aprobacion de esta ley llego a ser mejorada mas la labor de esta rama.

articles.title: Se reanuda la funcion de artistas militares
articles.content:
Se reanuda la funcion de artistas militares
Pyongyang, 17 de enero (ACNC) -- Transcurre con exito en estos dias en la Casa Cultural 25 de Abril la funcion de musica y danza "Enalteceremos siempre a nuestro Comandante Supremo".
					La funcion de este martes conmovio tambien a los espectadores poniendo de manifiesto el impetu combativo del ejercito revolucionario del monte Paektu y sus rasgos ideo-espirituales.
					
					Tras interpretado el Himno Nacional, los ejecutantes y espectadores guardaron un momento de silencio rindiendo los mas sentidos tributos a la memoria del Dirigente Kim Jong Il.
					
					En la escena iniciada con el inmortal himno revolucionario "Cancion del General Kim Jong Il", se presentaron las piezas de distintos generos, incluyendo la musica orquestal y coro mixto "Camarada Kim Jong Il es nuestro Comandante Supremo", el solo femenino y pangchang mixto "?Donde esta el querido General?" y el coro mixto "La fuerza de Corea".
					
					Cuando se proyectaron en el fondo de la escena las imagenes del Dirigente inspeccionando de dia y noche los puestos en el frente, los espectadores comenzaron a dar estruendosos aplausos.
					
					El coro mixto "No tiene fin la anoranza" les hizo llorar recordando al Dirigente que visitaba todos los lugares del pais donde se lograron considerables exitos en la construccion economica.
					
					Tambien se presentaron el trio masculino "Patria que yo defiendo", la danza tap "Marquemos el paso con la marcha militar", el solo y coro masculinos "Cancion de la camaraderia", el coro masculino "Ordene, Lider", la poesia en narracion "Dilo, Corea", la cancion "Pasos" y "Defenderemos a vida o muerte al General Kim Jong Un".
					
					La funcion arranco efusiva ovacion por su alto nivel ideo-artistico.

articles.title: ACNC comenta la continuacion de pruebas nucleares de EE.UU.
articles.content:
ACNC comenta la continuacion de pruebas nucleares de EE.UU.
Pyongyang, 17 de enero (ACNC) -- Hace poco, el mundo conocio con consternacion que Estados Unidos continuo en secreto las pruebas de armas nucleares. 
					Segun reporto Kyodo el dia 6, en verano del ano pasado EE.UU. realizo la prueba de plutonio usando una nueva tecnologia para chequear la eficiencia de los armamentos nucleares almacenados. 
					
					De esta manera, se ha revelado claramente el caracter hipocrita y enganoso de la promesa de la actual administracion norteamericana de no desarrollar las armas nucleares ni realizar las pruebas nucleares. 
					
					Al principio de su mandato, el actual mandatario estadounidense recibio el Premio Nobel de la Paz por abogar tanto por un "mundo libre de armas nucleares". 
					
					Pero, durante su mandato, se realizaron en EE.UU. con mas frecuencia y de modo mas sigiloso las pruebas de armas nucleares con inimaginable poder explosivo.
					
					Ademas, se da acicate a la modernizacion de armamentos nucleares. 
					
					Al trazar el proyecto presupuestario para el ano fiscal 2011, la administracion norteamericana solicito al congreso aprobar el egreso de mas de 7 mil millones de USD para las actividades del Buro Estatal de Seguridad Nuclear, o sea, 624 millones mas que el ano fiscal 2010.
					
					Un cientifico nuclear norteamericano dijo que "esos fondos han sido incrementados ahora al maximo desde la etapa inicial del mandato de la administracion Reagan". 
					
					Hasta los medios de prensa de EE.UU. censuran que la actual administracion pretende aumentar las inversiones en los planes de estudio de armas nucleares hablando por otra parte de la "no proliferacion" y la "desnuclearizacion". 
					
					EE.UU. sigue emplazando en varias regiones del mundo las armas nucleares y aumenta en la Peninsula Coreana el peligro de guerra nuclear. 
					
					La realidad muestra que la agresiva politica nuclear de EE.UU. no se cambiara nunca sea quien fuera el presidente. 
					
					El imperio tiene la invariable estrategia de tomar el dominio sobre el mundo al monopolizar armas nucleares y obtener la superioridad en el arsenal de armas estrategicas. 
					
					Para EE.UU., que considera los armamentos nucleares como medio omnipotente para la realizacion de su politica de agresion, es inconcebible el no uso o la cancelacion de armas nucleares. 
					
					Desde aquel dia en que impuso primer desastre nuclear a la humanidad hasta la fecha, EE.UU. no abandono ni un dia su politica nuclear de caracter agresivo sino vino fomentando la produccion y la proliferacion de armas nucleares. 
					
					Malgasta cada ano enormes fondos en la modernizacion de armas nucleares y traslada a los paises satelites la tecnologia nuclear intensificando abiertamente la amenaza nuclear contra sus rivales y los paises antiimperialistas e independientes. 
					
					Tanto ayer como hoy, EE.UU. es el que amenaza al mundo con la guerra nuclear y la carrera armamentista. 
					
					En nuestro planeta, EE.UU. ocupa el primer lugar en la posesion de armas nucleares de toda indole y en la transferencia de tecnologias nucleares. 
					
					Pues, la "desnuclearizacion", de que habla tanto el imperio, significa la de todos los paises y regiones excepto a si mismo, y la teoria de monopolizar las armas nucleares.
					
					  EE.UU., que toma la estrategia nuclear como pilar de su politica estatal, sigue hablando cinicamente de un "mundo sin armas nucleares". 
					
					Debe dejar de enganar al mundo y desistir de su criminal ambicion nuclear.
